name: Banana Bread
note: Taken from \href{https://www.food.com/recipe/best-banana-bread-2886}{food.com}. Best done with @3 overripe bananas, buy some, overripen them and chuck them into the freezer for later.
steps: Preheat oven to 180 degrees
Crush bananas
Mix butter and sugar, add eggs and banana
Sift in flour, soda, salt and add vanilla
Pour into bread pan and bake for 1 hour

name: Pizza Dough
note: Taken from Uncle Tony. This recipe revolves around the ratio, take the quantities listed here as a ratio and scale it to whatever is convenient. For a list of toppings, go to \hyperref[cat:Pizzas]{Pizzas}, which will all use this dough recipe.
steps: Mix warm water, yeast and sugar and stir to activate, then leave still for 15 minutes
Add oil, then Â¾ of the salt and Â¾ of the flour and whisk for 5 minutes
Whisk mixture while slowly adding the remaining salt and flour until the dough is moist and pliable
Knead until elastic (Approx. 10-15 minutes)
Rise until the dough has doubled in size
See â€˜Pizza' for sauce and toppings

name: Shortcrust Pastry
note: Taken from Stephanie Alexander. This recipe can be used for sweet and savoury tarts. To best results, keep everything, you, the benchtop, the water etc, cold. Making pastry is less about the recipe and more about the technique. It is very important to know the steps in advance because time is important.
steps: Sieve flour and salt onto the workbench and throw in chopped butter
Push flour into butter with fingertips
Roll into a heap with a well in the centre and add water
Continue mixing with fingertips, then gather into a head and push it away from you
Mix until all unmixed chunks of butter are gone, as they will leave pastry holes
Wrap in clingwrap and chill in fridge ASAP

name: Shortcrust Pastry (GF)
note: Taken from \href{https://champagneandgumboots.com.au/sweet-and-simple-gluten-free-shortcrust-pastry/}{Champagne and Gumboots}.
steps: Combine flours, sugar, xanthan gum and salt in mixmaster
Add chopped butter, blend until mixture resembles breadcrumbs
Add whisked egg, stir by hand
Add water, stir by hand
Wrap in clingwrap and refrigerate

name: Base Quiche
note: Got this from dad, made my own changes. Ingredients are highly flexible, this recipe is a good way to get rid of random veggies in the fridge, e.g. mushrooms, rocket. Can be vegetarian very easily.
steps: Preheat oven to 180
Defrost puff pastry (cover in tea towel for best results), defrost peas
Slice bacon and fry until cooked (don't overdo it here because it'll cook more in the oven)
Dice vegetables. Roughly rip up parsley into pieces
Whisk 5 eggs and combine with cheese
Place pastry into dish and combine all ingredients
Bake for 20-25 minutes and stand for 5

name: Roast Whole Chicken
note: Taken from Ottolenghi's cookbook Simple. Ignore the steps for stuffing and lemon to use as a basic roast chicken recipe or add your own ingredients.
steps: Preheat oven to 190 degrees
TBC

name: Meatballs With Red Sauce
note: Taken from Lorenzo and Woolworths. This recipe involves making a sauce and meatballs at the same time, for plain meatballs just don't add pasata. This works well to make a meatball sub or to be added to a pasta.
steps: Chop parsley and garlic, grate parmesan, whisk egg
Mix milk and breadcrumbs, mix egg, salt, pepper, cheese, parsley and mince
Once breadcrumbs are soaked, combine all ingredients and form into meatballs
SautÃ© in oil until browned, then add passata and simmer for 20 minutes with lid

name: Chicken Schnitzel
note: From Mum. Goes best with \hyperref[rec:Mashed Potato]{Mashed Potato} and a simple \hyperref[rec:Garden Salad]{Garden Salad}. Easily scalable and keeps well. Good for low quality chicken.
steps: Lay the breasts out flat and cut horizontally across into large thin slices
If lumps and irregularities remain, beat with a meat hammer
Crack eggs into large flat bowl and mix, pour breadcrumbs into another of the same bowls
Individually roll each slice of chicken through the egg, then the breadcrumbs
Shallow fry (High heat, lots of oil) in a pan until golden brown

name: Beer Bread
note: From Peter Van-Niekerk, good with barbeque, very crumbly. Goes well with added herbs or chorizo/bacon. Don't use for sandwiches
steps: Crush garlic into paste (guessing) (should be enough to make 2 tsp)
Set aside 1 cup pizza cheese and mix all other ingredients, rise for 45 minutes
Preheat oven to 180 degrees
Lay dough into a tray and sprinkle remaining cheese on top
Bake for 1 hour at 180 degrees
Stand to cool in tray for crumbly bread, remove for firmer bread

name: Pork Spring Rolls
note: From mum, who got it from a Thai cooking course. This recipe is time consuming and needs specific spring roll wrappers and access to a deep fryer, so is likely inconvenient. It is important not to overcook the rolls to keep them crispy. Works well with \hyperref[rec:Sweet Dipping Sauce]{Sweet Dipping Sauce}
steps: Cover pork in water and simmer for 20 minutes then blend up
Pour oil, pork, prawn and onion until prawn is pink, then add salt, pepper, sugar, shallots and coriander roots. Stir to dissolve sugar
Add carrot, stir for a moment and then place in bowl to cool
Dampen wrappers with a tea towel and mix water and cornflour
Take 1 wrapper, corner towards you and coat edges with cornflour mixture
Place filling on nearest corner, roll up, fold sides in then seal and drop into deep fryer

name: Nachos
note: From woolworths. Can use beef instead for easier cooking. Layering ensures that the chips don't end up bland or dry. Add carrots, peas, etc. Vegetables very easily dissapear into the mix.
steps: Cut vegetables and chicken into mid-sized pieces
Fry vegetables, onion first then add each ingredient in sequence
Separately, on high heat fry chicken in two batches
Drain beans and combine with vegetables
Add vegetables, chicken and salsa to a large bowl and mix
Spread some mix over the base of a 30x20cm tray
Sprinkle cheese layer
Place a layer of chips
Continue layering down these three ingredients until the tray is full
Bake in the oven for 15-20 minutes until cheese is browned

diary.content: vego variation: 1.5 cans black beans, 2 onions, 1 red capsicum, 1 jar salsa. small but deep dish, didn't use the whole thing of chips. fried onions, then added capsicum, both on pretty high heat. then beans, lowered heat and eventually added salsa, cooked until aroma nicer. layered and then baked at 200c for 25 minutes.

name: Whole Fish With Ginger Sauce
note: From mum, who got it from a Thai cooking course. Formidable ingredients list means I've never cooked this. Before the cornflour is added, the sauce should taste sweet and slightly salty/sour.
steps: Wash, trim and pat dry the fish and cook as desired (Grill/Fry/Steam)
Chop garlic, spring onion (2cm pieces), ginger root (finely), capsicum (strips), onion (slice)
Mix cornflour, adding water slowly to form a paste
Heat a frypan and add oil, garlic, spring onion, ginger, fish sauce, sugar. Stir and cook at medium heat
After a few minutes, add turmeric, stock, tamarind and pepper
Remove from heat, stir 2 tsp of cornflour paste and return to low heat
Stir in capsicum, onion and wood fungus
Pour over fish and garnish with coriander

name: Basil Chicken Pesto
note: From Dad. Can get rid of chicken, can substitue carrot for sweet potato. Best to use the homemade \hyperref[rec:Basil Pesto]{Basil Pesto}. If using a jar, tip it in, then half fill with water and shake it to dislodge the rest.
steps: Set 5 litres of water in a pot, add 3 tbsp salt and boil
Dice chicken, sweet potato and onion
Set onions on low heat to caramelise, fry sweet potato on medium heat (char slightly)
On high heat fry chicken in 2-3 batches
When water has boiled, add pasta and cook for 10-12 minutes to al dente
Drain pasta into strainer
Pour all other ingredients, including the pesto, into the pot
Stir, add pasta back and stir again
Serve and garnish with parmesan (shaved with peeler)

name: Bolognese
note: From family. Add carrots and peas for extra vegetables. Make napolitana by removing mince, make marinara by changing mince for seafood mix.
steps: Chop onion and place in saucepan until brown, do the same with garlic
Add mince, stirring until brown
Add pasata, tomato paste, sugar, salt, pepper and wine, cover with lid and simmer for 30 minutes
Boil water with salt, cook pasta for 12 minutes, drain and combine with sauce

name: Carbonara
note: From mum, delicious and filling.
steps: Salt and boil water, cook pasta for 12 minutes and drain
Chop onion, bacon, mushroom and garlic, fry to brown in that order
Add cream and other ingredients (go light on the worcestershire sauce)
Throw in peas and mix
Stir on heat to thicken and slightly colour
Add pasta, mix and serve

diary.content: Left out mushrooms, still good but missing something a little bit.

name: Bechamel
note: From Stephanie Alexander. Fine to make but just stir it all the time, heating the milk makes it easier to add to the roux.
steps: Heat milk to scalding and set aside
Melt butter and stir in flour
Stir mix frequently until slightly brown (a roux)
Gradually add milk, stirring literally constantly or it will lump
Cook for 10 minutes on lowest heat (ideally simmer mat), stirring

name: Tuna Pasta Bake
note: From Dad. Cheap and lasts fairly well. Worth the effort to add in a \hyperref[rec:Bechamel]{Bechamel Sauce} when mixing everything else in. Peas, carrots etc as well.
steps: Boil water and add salt
Chop parsley
Preheat oven to 180 degrees
Boil pasta for 10 minutes
Strain pasta, mix in all ingredients, saving some cheese to top with
Pour into tray, cover with cheese and bake for 15-20 minutes until brown

name: Lasagne
note: From Mum's recipe, with Stephanie Alexander's bechamel. Can substitue the bechamel entirely for ricotta to save time. Tray should be 20x30cm.
steps: Make the \hyperref[rec:Bolognese]{Bolognese sauce} as per the \hyperref[rec:Bolognese]{linked recipe}, leaving out the pasta
Preheat the oven to 180 degrees
Make the \hyperref[rec:Bechamel]{Bechamel sauce}
Layer the components bolognese then bechamel then sheet and repeat
Top with grated cheese
Bake for 45-60 minutes TBC

diary.content: Didn't cook today but note from previously. Should do with smaller dish and make it twice as thick.

name: Cheesy Garlic Pizza
note: From Uncle Tony, simple recipe, tastes great. Very greasy, high temperature may need adjustment.
steps: Press garlic and mix with pinch of salt
Brush pizza base with oil, then spread the garlic paste
Sprinkle oregano and cheese
Bake for 7 minutes at 260 degrees

name: Tony's Cabanossi Pizza
note: From Uncle Tony, a family get together classic. Quantities listed are just placeholders, no accuracy needed. Don't forget salami, and probably remove the mushrooms.
steps: Cover base with tomato paste
Evenly distribute other ingredients, topping with cheese last
Bake for 7 minutes at 260 degrees

name: Margherita Pizza
note: This sauce works great fried up with leftover vegetables. Should garnish with basil leaves below the cheese.
steps: Chop onion and olives
Heat saucepan and add oil, throw in onion, olives, tomato and seasonings
Cook for 7 minutes on medium heat, let cool
Spread on dough
Top with cheese
Bake for 7 minutes at 260 degrees

name: Bacon Stir Fry
note: TBC. Quantities are approximate. The point of this recipe is to use whatver ingredients are in the fridge.
steps: Pour rice into pot and cover (plus 2 fingers height) with water, bring to boil and cook for 8 minutes
Chop other ingredients
Fry all (Order: Onion, carrot, bacon, bok choy, seasoning)
Combine with rice

name: Sticky Pork Stir-Fry
note: Taken from Taste. Chop the veggies real thinly because they don’t spend much time in the pan. Chop the garlic and ginger a little fatter for extra kick. Best to make with rice.
steps: Chop pork into chunks, mix with sugar, soy sauce, five spice in a bowl
Chop carrots, pak choy, onion, capsicum, garlic and gingerc
Fry pork until golden
Fry carrots, onion, garlic, ginger, capsicum until just tender
Add pork, pak choy and cashews and fry a moment longer
Serve, ideally with rice

name: Smashed Potato
note: From Gordon Doyle, during a particularly long train ride. Never cooked, possibly never will
steps: Preheat oven to 220 and set a pot to boil
Boil unpeeled potatoes until fully cooked
Move to cutting board, cut a cross into each potato and gently squash each of them
Move onto a tray, drizzle with oil, salt, pepper and bake for 1 hour
Garnish with parsley before serving

name: Potato Gratin
note: From Dad. Cooked with Mum and Lorenzo and then much later cooked at Eastwood apartment. Takes an enormous amount of time for a side. Turn on top element. For next time: consider removing foil at end to brown the top better.
steps: Preheat oven to 230 degrees (fan-forced)
Slice potato and onion thin and lay across tray in several layers
Melt butter, then add flour and 50 ml milk at a time while stirring
Then add mustard, salt and pepper and cook for 5 minutes
Dissolve stock cubes in cup of hot water and pour over potatoes
Then pour sauce over potatoes, sprinkle with cheese and paprika, cover in foil and bake for 90 minutes

name: Milo Biscuits
note: From \href{https://www.food.com/recipe/jessgarfields-milo-biscuits-123173}{Food.com}, but altered to match Nanna’s classic version. Really easy to make, yields a very crispy biscuit. 2022/09/14 revision: took 15 or 20 minutes, heat on the high side of 160 FF, press flat and score with fork, using 3 cm balls
steps: Preheat oven to 160 degrees
Mix sugars, vanilla and butter until creamy
Add egg, then flour, then milo and mix until combined
Form into 3cm (was 2cm) balls and squash onto tray with a fork, leave plenty of room for them to spread
Bake for 10-15 minutes

name: Anzac Biscuits
note: From Nanna’s old recipes, which used ounce measurements, since converted. Simple and chewy, keeps well.
steps: Preheat oven to 160 degrees
Mix oats, sugar, coconut, melt syrup and butter together, mix bi-carb and water, add to butter/syrup
Mix all together, stir well and add flour
Spoon onto tray and bake at 160 degrees for 12 minutes

diary.content: Yum but uses very little golden syrup, maybe try with more?

name: Macadamia and White Choc Biscuits
note: This recipe is designed to imitate Subway cookies and is taken from Genius kitchen, who have rebranded themselves as \href{https://www.food.com/recipe/subway-white-chocolate-macadamia-nut-cookies-389301?mode=US&scaleto=48}{food.com}. Their website allows you to scale this recipe for any number of cookies. The cookies are ridiculously unhealthy, with huge amounts of butter sugar and chocolate, the website actually provides nutritional information. The cookies will continue cooking after being taken out and taste best soft, so take them out when lightly browned.
steps: Preheat oven to 180 degrees
Mix flour, baking soda and salt in a large bowl
Beat butter until creamy (Preferably in a mixer), add brown sugar and beat again
Add eggs (one at a time, beating after each), add vanilla, beat, add flour gradually, mix well
Add white chocolate and macadamia, mix only until blended
Place dough on baking sheets and bake for 10-12 minutes (under-bake slightly for best results)

name: Apple Crumble
note: From \href{https://www.recipetineats.com/apple-crumble/}{Recipe Tin Eats}. Make sure the oven has a hot top element for browning. Flour to the apples is a good addition, the base gets a nice bit syrupy. Plenty of crumble in this ratio. Don’t bother precooking the apple. Don’t forget to get cream/ice-cream.
steps: Preheat oven to 180 degrees
Melt butter in a saucepan
Cut apples into 1.5 cm cubes
Toss apple with other base ingredients in baking tray
Mix all topping ingredients and spread over tray
Bake for 50 minutes until brown, cover with foil for 10 minutes and serve

name: Apple Cake
note: From Mum, original recipe doubled, sugar reduced from 2 to 1.5 cups. Use lots of cinnamon, leave apples unpeeled for texture. The cooking time is very dependent on the tin this is put into. The recipe calls for a flat slice tin but I have always used a deeper dish. It is done when the top is golden brown and a skewer comes out clean.
steps: Preheat oven to 180 degrees
Dice apples into 1.5cm cubes and toss with flour and sugar
Melt butter, stir in egg and pour mixture into the bowl with apples, mixing until combined
Spoon into tin of choice and bake for 30-40 minutes

name: Passionfruit Cheesecake
note: From \href{https://www.stayathomemum.com.au/recipes/no-bake-passionfruit-jelly-cheesecake/}{Stay At Home Mum}. I find this one difficult because I hardly ever cook with gelatine and it’s hard to judge the right amount. Make sure you have the right size tin and make sure it has a removable base, preferably a springform cake tin.
steps: Crumb the digestives in a food processor then blend with butter, set into tray and refrigerate
Blend cheese, 3/4 cup sugar and vanilla together, whip cream and add to cheese mixture, blend again
Soften 1 gelatine sheet in a glass of water for 2-5 minutes, then melt in a saucepan and pour into cheese mixture and blend again
Pour the cream cheese over the base and refrigerate
Halve the passionfruit and spoon out the pulp, then mix with 1/4 cup sugar, water and 3 sheets gelatine prepared as before
Pour onto cream cheese filling and refrigerate for 1-2 hours

name: Rocky Road
note: From scouts. None of these quantities really matter, just pour in what you have. Works well with crushed biscuits, macadamia nuts, coconut, or glace cherries in place of raspberries.
steps: Cut marshmallows and raspberries into halves
Melt chocolate on the stove
Stir everything together and place on lined tray
Set in fridge for at least 30 minutes

name: Lemon Tart
note: From Stephanie Alexander, also using her \hyperref[rec:Shortcrust Pastry]{shortcrust pastry} recipe. I add some extra cream, which extends it to 2 tarts. For the shortcrust pastry recipe, see the pastry section. To make the tart look pretty, sprinkle with icing sugar before serving.
steps: Preheat oven to 200 degrees

While oven preheats, arrange the pastry into a tray. Clean and flour a workspace, flour both a rolling pin, a tart dish and a sheet of aluminium foil to cover it, get ready a jar of pie weights (can substitute chickpeas).

Quickly pull the pastry out of the fridge, flour, then roll into a flat, even circle. Lay it into the dish, pat the corners into place and roll the pin across the top to cut the excess. Lay foil over top and pour in pie weights.  Place back in fridge if the oven isn’t ready. Bake in the oven for 20 minutes until crust is brown
Zest and juice lemon
Combine eggs and sugar, mix, add lemon and zest (I only use about half the zest), mix, add cream, mix

When the pastry is done, drop the oven to 160 degrees. Remove the pie weights from the pastry case, place the dish in the oven and pour the filling directly on, until just full. Bake for 35 minutes, until a skewer comes out clean
Leave to stand for 5 minutes

name: Basil Pesto
note: The quantities aren’t at all exact, do pretty much everything to taste. Pine nuts are a pain to find, substitute with cashews. Can add parmesan, but it won't keep as long if you do.
steps: Toast the pine nuts on low heat, single layered in the pan
Wash and chop the basil along the stem, chop garlic
Stir all ingredients into food processor, blend until no chunks remain, taste and balance flavours

name: SR Flour
note: Not actually sure if it is baking powder. TBC.
steps: Mix and sift thoroughly

name: Pavlova
note: From Dad's pavlova plate. Family classic.
steps: Whip egg whites and sugar to peaks.
Add cornflour, vanilla and vinegar.
Spoon onto wet plate.
Bake at 120 degrees for 1 hour.
Turn off and leave to cool.

name: Almond Frangipane

yields.extra: Enough to fill a 20cm tart dish

note: From Dad, who got it from an old recipe for Twelfth Night Frangipane Cake, which uses this as a filling and involves hiding 2 coins inside the tart. Quite quick to make, works great in croissants or as filling for a tart flan. The ground almonds don't really need to be sifted.
steps: Chop butter and allow to soften
Sift the icing sugar and ground almonds into a bowl and combine
Whisk egg
Combine cointreau with egg
Add liquid mix to dry mix, then add butter and combine

name: Strawberry Flan
note: From Dad, using Stephanie Alexander's \hyperref[rec:Shortcrust Pastry]{shortcrust pastry}. Works well with a bunch of fruits. Pear and apple can be thinly sliced and layered over each other, cherries work halved, many options. When serving, sift some icing sugar over the top. Instead of pie weights, roasted rice or chickpeas both work great.
steps: Make the \hyperref[rec:Shortcrust Pastry]{shortcrust pastry} and cool in fridge
Make the \hyperref[rec:Almond frangipane]{almond frangipane}
Preheat oven to 180 degrees
Roll the pastry out to cover the 20cm and 25cm tart dishes
Lay baking paper over the top and fill tart case with pie weights
Bake pastry blind at 180 degrees for 10 minutes
Chop the strawberries into quarters
Pour the frangipane into the tart dish and spread evenly, lay strawberries across the top
Bake at 200 degrees for 20 minutes
Remove from oven and cool for 10 minutes

name: Za'atar Munoushee
note: Originally tried at Munoushee Concord across from school. Cooked with Kora at college. Can do in oven as well.
steps: Combine za'atar and oil in a bowl, adjust for consistency
Spread za'atar and cheese onto one side of flatbread and fold
Toast until brown

name: French Toast
note: From \href{https://www.recipetineats.com/wprm_print/26510}{Recipe Tin Eats} but a pretty standard recipe. Cooked a bunch with Mik at college. Extra delish with brioche bread, can even use brioche buns or raisin toast. Top with banana and yoghurt, or berries or syrup or nothing at all.
steps: Whisk egg
Pour in all other ingredients
Dunk bread (both sides)
Fry in hot pan with butter

name: Flatbread (Yoghurt)
note: Made back in Westleigh when home alone. Made again in college with Clauds. Easily made, I'm guessing the quantities. Keep a bit spare of each ingredient so you can adjust, and add very slowly, mixing throughly. If you don't roll really thin, the inside will be raw.
steps: Mix the two ingredients bit by bit, until not too sticky
Set aside for 20 minutes in bowl
Split into balls and roll flat
Fry on high heat in oil

name: Tarte Dijonnaise
note: From a Vittles email with subject "A prodigious attitude to cream", cites as from Maison Bertaux, according to a recipe by Mark Hix. Recommends serving warm, maybe with salad. Cooked, works good as a lunch. Needs to be faster, make some convenience substitutions, don't bother with fancy cheese.
steps: Preheat oven to 180 degrees fan forced, line shallow tray with baking paper
Dice onion and capsicum finely, grate cheddar, beat eggs (lightly)
Fry onion and capsicum in the oil over medium heat for 15 min. Cover with lid, stir often.
Lay the pastry on the tray, bake for 10 minutes. Set aside.
To the veggies, add the cheese, eggs, cream, mustard, salt and pepper. Combine and adjust
Flip the pastry sheet and spread the mixture across in a thick, even layer
Bake for 18-20 min, until lightly browned at the edges

name: Fennel Risotto
note: From a Vittles article on Substack (subject: Soaking up the juicy morsels of our lives), by Claire-Louise Bennett. Aside from step 1, the procedure is verbatim. Plan is to take this recipe as an approach to risotto, and just rejig all the ingredients (I don't like fennel). Recommends serving with a green salad. Provides some optional extra ingredients: Butter, fennel bulb (but sliced roughly and roasted), walnuts (cool idea) and feta cheese. Mentions making your own stock earlier in the day with carrot, celery, onions, peppercorns, bay leaf, a couple of whole tomatoes, some scrubbed lemon wedges and parsley stems "and so on". Throw them in the pot and simmer for a while, then gently reheat in time to cook the rice (don't boil).
steps: Finely dice onions. Remove tough outer layer from fennel and slice thinly. Crush or grate garlic. Grate lemon zest from 1 lemon. Roughly chop parsley.
Add olive oil to a wide pan set over a medium heat. When it's hot, add the chopped onion and fennel and cook gently, stirring constantly until it starts to soften.
Once the fennel is slightly softened and the onion is golden, add the garlic and cook for a minute or so. Don’t let the garlic brown or it will taste bitter.
Pour in the rice and stir, coating with the fragrant oil. Toast the rice for a couple of minutes and then pour in the wine or beer. Stir constantly until the liquid more or less disappears.
Sprinkle in a few chilli flakes if you like - it adds some warmth.

Turn the heat down to medium-low, and begin ladling in the stock. Pour yourself another drink, light up, launch into another unbelievable bit of news. Stir, pour, ladle, smoke, chatter. You can stop stirring from time to time, and you can turn the heat right down if you think the rice is in danger of being ready too soon.

Once the rice can absorb nothing more and is tender, add lemon zest and parsley and season generously. At this point you can fold in some butter, but generally a little grated parmesan is sufficient. If I’m finishing off with optional extras - roasted fennel, roasted red pepper, walnuts, feta cheese - then I skip the parmesan.
Let it cool down a bit before serving with a green salad.

name: Potato Salad
note: From a Vittles Cooking From Life article by Molly Pepper Steemson. Listed in her recipes for a low-key passover, as a side to matzo breaded schnitzel. Email subject line "Schnitzel, Salads \& Fake Meat"
steps: Cut large potatoes in half, slice spring onions, chop chives and juice lemon
Add potatoes to a saucepan of cold salted water, bring to the boil and cook for 15-20 minutes, until tender. Drain well and set aside for a few minutes to steam dry
While potatoes are cooking, mix together the mayonnaise, mustard and lemon juice
Combine wet mix with potatoes, spring onions, chives. Season to taste with salt and pepper

name: Orange and Almond Cake
note: From Claudia Roden via \href{https://www.theguardian.com/food/2022/sep/26/claudia-roden-recipe-for-orange-and-almond-cake}{The Guardian}. States unknown origin, lists Andalucia, Portugal, Livorno, Aleppo, Iberia. For tin, recommends a non-stick tin with removable base. Should be a very moist cake, but if still too wet leave in for a little longer.
steps: Wash oranges (whole, unpeeled)
Boil oranges in a little water for 1.5-2 hours until very soft. Let cool.
Preheat oven to 170 degrees
Cut open oranges, remove pips, then puree with food processor
Beat eggs
Add all other ingredients to eggs and mix thoroughly
Butter and flour a cake tin
Pour mixture into tin and bake for 1 hour
Cool in tin before turning out

name: Choc Chip Biscuits
note: From dad, who got it from Nanna, who got it off of the back of the Nestle choc bits packaging but never told the Hills that. Cooked for our whole apartment building (quadruple batch) as our introduction to the building, left outside their doors and knocked. We recieved several conversations, a box of ferrero rochers and a handdrawn picture of a cookie from the kid downstairs.
steps: Chop butter and soften
Preheat oven to 170 (150 fan-forced), line biscuit trays
Whisk egg in bowl.
Beat butter and brown sugar, add egg, beat lightly, add flour and choc chips and mix well.
Shape into small (tbsp sized) cookies, place on tray and press flat
Bake for 15 minutes or until golden, set aside on tray for 5 minutes, cool on rack.

name: Enchiladas
note: From \href{https://myfoodbook.com.au/recipes/show/chicken-and-rice-enchiladas}{myfoodbook}. Cooked with Claudia as the inaugural meal in our new home in Eastwood. Serve with sour cream, chopped avocado and pica de gallo.
steps: Boil water and cook rice.
Dice onions.
Fry onion on low-medium heat until caramelised.
Preheat oven to 200 (180 fan-forced).
Dice chicken and drain beans
Toss chicken in the spice mix then fry in batches on high heat.
Mix salsa and diced tomato in a bowl
Cover base of large baking dish with 1/3 of the salsa.
Transfer beans, rice, onions and chicken to a bowl and stir in 2 tbsp of salsa mix
Lay out all tortillas and fill with a scoop of cheese and a scoop of the mixture. Roll and place in baking dish.
Pour remaining salsa mix over top. Cover in cheese.
Bake at 200 for 25 minutes, until cheese is golden.

diary.content: recipe order confusing and inefficient. I've made changes

name: Caramelised Onion and Tomato Risotto
note: From \href{https://www.connoisseurusveg.com/tomato-risotto/}{Connoisseurus Veg} (awesome logo). Cooked this for our first dinner with guests in Doomben Avenue, for Nat and Amish. They brought cinnamon cake. Try next time with 1 can tinned tomatoes instead, and maybe fry the onion on higher heat at the start to get the temperature up fast. Try doubling the recipe and see what happens. Serve with toasted sourdough, shredded cheese, and chopped basil leaves
steps: Slice the onions thinly and place in pot with oil on medium heat for 30 minutes.
Mince garlic.
Halve the tomatoes, arrange cut side up in a large roasting tray and rub with pepper, drizzle with oil. Roast for 25 minutes, until wrinkly and blistered.
Allow tomatoes to cool, then coarsely chop tomatoes (keep pan juices).
After 30 minutes of frying, add the sugar to the onions and continue frying for another 30 minutes. They should have begun to brown by now.
Preheat oven to 200 degrees (fan forced).
Raise heat to medium under onions and add garlic, saute for 1 minute until fragrant.
Stir in wine, tomatoes, tomato paste and thyme, bring to a boil.
Lower heat and cook for 5 minutes, until liquid reduces by about a third.
Stir in arborio and simmer, stirring frequently until most of the remaining liquid has been absorbed by the rice.
Add stock, 0.5 cup at a time, simmering until most of the liquid has been absorbed. Stir frequently. Do this process for 20 minutes, until rice is tender.
Stir in coconut milk and simmer for 3 minutes, until thick and creamy. Season with salt and pepper.

name: Pumpkin Quiche
note: Another basic take on a quiche, pumpkins go quite nicely. Vaguely adapted from mum's quiche, but not really, hers it nicer and uses shortcrust pastry. Use this recipe when you have leftover roast pumpkin, reheat it in the pan. Can substitute with other vegetable, e.g. sweet potato.
steps: Preheat oven to 180 degrees (fan forced)
Dice pumpkin into small chunks, cover in oil, salt and pepper.
Roast pumpkin for 60 minutes or until soft.
Dice onion.
Fry onion on high heat until edges are singed then drop heat to medium.
Whisk eggs in large mixing bowl, add milk, cheese, salt, pepper and stir.
Add peas to frypan (and pumpkin if using cold leftovers) and toss to warm up.
Add veggies to mixing bowl and pour over quiche dish.
Bake for 30 minutes.
Take puff pastry out and defrost, cover with teatowel.
Line quiche tray with pastry.

name: Egg Fried Rice
note: Basic recipe when hungry.
steps: Add rice and 2 cups water to a saucepan and bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes. (Check packet for correct method, can't remember).
Fry onions on high heat til edges brown, then reduce heat and cook as slowly as bothered to.
Whisk eggs.
When rice nearly arrived, add carrots, peas, ginger and soy sauce to frypan.
In separate pan, scramble eggs.
Ensure rice is drained, then combine all ingredients and add more sauce.

name: Gingerbread Biscuits
note: The classic Christmas biscuit recipe, an annual tradition between Lorenzo, Dad and I. We make a triple batch, cut into christmas shapes and wrap with cellophane and ribbons to give out. Can use golden syrup instead of treacle.
steps: Grease several baking trays
Beat butter and sugar, then beat in treacle and egg
Whisk egg
Sift flour and grind spices
Sift in the flours, spices and baking soda
Knead for 3 minutes, until smooth
Plastic wrap and chill in fridge (10 minutes or so)
Preheat oven to 180
Roll out dough and cut with cookie cutters, place on trays
Bake for 10 minutes, cool for 5

name: White Bread
note: From the Common Sense Cookery Book. I've made the most minor of modifications, mainly just that I do 2 big loaves rather than 3 small. Cooked first time went very well, burnt on base a little, 25 min was good, 30 min too dry. Cooked a second time, loaves did not rise in pans and are much smaller, less cooked. Still burnt on bottom.
steps: Mix yeast, 1 tsp flour, 1 tsp sugar, 0.5 cup warm water in a glass and wait for bubbles.
Sift flour into remaining sugar and salt, make a well and pour in yeast mix and remaining 2 cups warm water.
Mix well and then knead until "smooth, satiny and not sticky", until dough springs back when pressed.
Place in a greased bowl, turn over (to grease the other surface), then cover with wet teatowel and rise for 35-40 minutes, until doubled.
Preheat oven to 240 degrees (not fan-forced).
Flour 2 loaf pans.
Turn out bread, lightly knead and then roll flat into rectangle as wide as tins are long.
Roll dough into spiral, seal side not ends, and place into tins. Rise for 10-20 minutes.
Bake for 25 minutes. Done if loaf sounds hollow when knocked on.
Turn out onto cooling rack.

name: Fettuccine Alfredo
note: From \href{https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/23431/to-die-for-fettuccine-alfredo/}{allrecipes}, cooked for Darcy when he first came around to the apartment. Way too oily, maybe too much cheese. A very simple flavour. Needs veggies, can throw in spinach. Serve with shaved parmesan and maybe a simple salad.
steps: Chop onions
Fry onions over high heat, then drop heat back once they brown
Bring pot of water to boil and add fettuccine, cook for 8-10 minutes then drain.
Chop butter into blocks and melt into cream in saucepan over low heat.
Grate parmesan.
Add cheese, salt, pepper, garlic salt into saucepan and cook until thickened.
Combine sauce, vegetables and pasta, serve.

name: Bechamel Pie
note: A great fallback pie, cooked this instead of spag-bol pies because we forgot to refrigerate the spaghetti overnight. Uses stuff you have lying around, handles random vegetables very well.
steps: Heat frypan, chop onions, throw them in.
Chop carrots, mushrooms.
Make bechamel sauce (heat milk then butter and flour in saucepan, add milk bit by bit)
Take pastry out of freezer, cover with teatowel.
Throw in carrots, then put heat on high and fry mushrooms.
Add to sauce and stir, take off heat.
Cut pastry into pie shapes.
Assemble pies in piemaker and cook til golden.

name: Potato Curry
note: From The Cook's Companion, but I skip a bunch of the ingredients so I don't have to buy extra stuff. Goes alright. Highly recommend serving with plain flatbread, like Aldi paratha. Makes somewhere between 3 and 4 serves.
steps: Chop onion, ginger, garlic.
Heat 3 tbsp oil in saucepan on medium high heat. Toss onion, ginger, garlic in and saute with curry powder, cinnamon, turmeric, cardamon,
For 5 minutes.
Chop potatoes, carrots, green beans, put tomatoes in food processor.
Add vegetables, stir in for a minute or so, then add tomato, cover and simmer for 20 minutes.
To a large pot, add 2 cups basmati rice, 4 cups cold water, 2 tsp salt, 1 tbsp vegetable oil, bring to boil then simmer for 10 minutes.
Add coconut milk to sauce and then simmer uncovered for 10 minutes.
Optionally, fry some paratha while waiting for sauce.

name: Red Sauce Rigatoni
note: Loosely based on Mum's recipe, aims for a very reduced, clingy sauce. This recipe comes a bit strong, try with passata. Doesn't use too many pots or pans. Can substitute rigatoni for normal penne
steps: Chop onions roughly and throw into large saucepan on high heat.
Chop carrots and toss with onions once onions are browned.
Chop garlic and toss into pot once carrots are browned, fry for a bit.
Add cherry tomatoes, tomato paste, sugar, wine, salt, pepper and stir.
Simmer for 30 minutes, adding peas towards the end.
Boil 3L of water, add 2 tbsp salt and throw pasta in for 10-12 minutes.
Stir pasta into sauce and serve.

diary.content: Followed recipe but with only 1 tbsp tomato sauce. Yum but probably too rich, definitely too sweet.

name: Apple Cinnamon Muffins
note: From \href{https://www.recipetineats.com/brown-sugar-apple-muffins/}{recipetineats}, promising to make fluffy, longlasting muffins. Needs more cinnamon. Don't bother whisking egg before adding to bowl. Apple should be about 2 cups worth once chopped. Wholemeal flour is maybe more yummy, but can use plain.
steps: Preheat oven to 200 degrees.
Melt butter in saucepan.
Dice apple into small pieces and line 12 muffin tray with paddycases.
Whisk to combine melted butter and brown sugar.
Add milk, then egg and vinegar. Whisk to combine.
Scatter flour, baking soda, cinnamon and salt over batter. Whisk to minimally combine (clumps okay).
Stir in apple chunks.
Scoop into paddycases and sprinkle tops with a pinch of white sugar.
Place in oven and turn oven down to 180 degrees. Bake for 20 minutes, rest in tin for 5, cool on racks.

name: Gyros
note: A very fresh flavour, minimal prep. Can switch out the halloumi for lamb. Buy the fanciest, fluffiest pita you can find. Woolworths mission brand souvlaki wraps are good. Needs more grease
steps: Dice cucumbers, tomatoes, onions into 1.5cm chunks.
Slice halloumi to 8mm thick and then tear into large chunks. Toss with herbs and oil.
Fry halloumi over medium heat until golden.
Warm wraps on medium heat without oil
Assemble at table.

name: Pad See Ew
note: Using a recipetineats recipe from the cookbook \textit{Dinner}, gifted recently by Dad as a christmas present. This was the first recipe I used it for, and the first time I cooked noodles by myself. I went into eastwood and visited 5 different shops to source the ingredients, and was helped by lots of shop attendants trying to figure out what I was on about. Delightful recipe to cook, all goes into pan. I accidentally bought fresh rice noodles instead, worked great.
steps: Dice garlic very finely. Chop gai lan to a length of 7.5cm, and separate stems from leaves.
Mix soy sauces, oyster sauce, white vinegar and white sugar in a bowl until combined.
Cook noodles and drain.
Heat 1 tbsp oil in frying pan on maximum heat.
Add garlic, stir for 10 seconds until golden.
Add chicken, cook for 30 seconds until white but still raw.
Add gai lan stems, cook 1 minute.
Add gai lan leaves, stir for 20 seconds until just wilted.
Push pan contents to side and crack eggs in, scramble them then transfer all contents to plate.
Heat 2 tbsp oil in pan to smoking, then add cooked noodles and sauce and toss sparingly for 2 minutes.
Combine ingredients and serve right away.

diary.content: i have cooked this meal, on earth as is in heaven

fhdsrngjds gdsr vd nbgdr hgv dhj nxhjv dsjk gds vsjk vjksz vsgjd bmdfsgsd vhj,sddjh, nhx. and then i  fse jfshfse fs .,ngsmgds ngd. ,sg very good. i recommend bhjasbgfes bf efsf esf sbsfbhjfsf esf esf es fs f.
Substituted chicken with tofu. Squeezed tofu before cooking, should've squeezed more. Got edges crispy but still very plain, need to find a sauce to marinate it in.

name: Hokkien Mee
note: From the recipetineats cookbook \textit{Dinner}. Their recipe has prawns, pork and anchovies. I took them all out and admittedly the flavour is fairly basic but these noodles are a lot of fun. Buy the fresh noodles (I got them vacuum packed from the fridge at New Yen Yen).
steps: Cover noodles in hot water and sit for a bit.
Halve onion and slice into 5mm pieces. Halve carrot and slice diagonally 3mm. Slice wombok into 25cm, then chop into halves. Dice garlic as fine as you can.
Mix oyster sauce, water, cornflour, brown sugar, dark soy sauce, soy sauce together in a bowl.
Drain noodles.
On high heat, add 1 tbsp canola oil and onions, fry for 1min
Add garlic, fry for 20 seconds.
Add carrot and wombok, fry for 2.5 minutes.
Add noodles and sauce, fry for 4.5 minutes until coated.

name: Beef Burgers
note: Make sure you get the frypan nice and hot, or the patties will come out gray.
steps: Slice onions, fry in pan on medium heat for as long as you'll wait, until brown
Slice tomatoes, lettuce into big slices.
Preheat oven to 220 degrees.
Bake chips for 30 minutes or according to packet.
Mix mince, breadcrumbs, egg, salt and pepper in bowl and shape into @6 patties.
Mix tomato sauce, mayonnaise, mustard in a bowl.
In a grill or toaster, brown the inside of the buns.
On high heat, add oil, salt and pepper to a pan and place 3 patties at a time on it. Cook for 3 minutes a side.
Assemble burgers and serve.

diary.content: Cooked for 4 today. Way too much lettuce, patties on mid-high not max heat, a bit breadcrumbey. Making quarter pounders is nice in theory but people seem to want smaller - will make 1/6 pound patties instead.

name: Chicken Shawarma
note: From recipetineats, the cookbook \textit{Dinner}. I leave out the hot sauce at a few stages. Make sure you leave time to marinate the chicken overnight.
steps: Chop 1 garlic clove as small as you can, juice lemon
Combine all the marinade ingredients in large bowl, add chicken, toss, cover and leave for up to 24 hours in fridge.
Mix the ingredients for the yoghurt sauce in a serving bowl.
To cook chicken: place 1 tbsp oil on medium-high heat, add half the chicken and cook for 4 minutes per side (more if thick pieces), put on plate loosely wrapped in foil. Do second batch.
Slice lettuce into thin strips, slice tomatoes in half then slice thin.
Serve all the ingredients to table, assemble there.

name: Chinese Fried Rice
note: From recipetineats, the cookbook \textit{Dinner}. Actually pretty quick to cook. Cook a few cups of rice and freeze them, then use them for this. Don't worry about skipping shallots, and can add bacon to this.
steps: Dice onions (8mm squares) and garlic (as small as you can).
In pan on high, heat 1.5 tbsp canola oil until smoking and add onions, garlic. Fry for 1.5 minutes.
Whisk eggs in a bowl.
Add frozen vegetables to frypan, fry for 2 minutes.
Mix seasoning ingredients in a bowl.
Add rice and seasoning to the pan, fry for 1.5 minutes.
Push rice to side of pan, recentre empty space over burner, add 0.5 tbsp canola oil and scramble the eggs.
Add shallots and combine. Serve.

diary.content: Tried to use minimal dishes. Meant I poured the seasoning over the rice once in the pan (would be better to bring ingredients closer to stove, or pour into rice if in a ziploc). Also tried to scramble in the pan, worked okay but I need to crack eggs w/o getting hands dirty - no time to wash them without the eggs frying. Do less onion.

name: Sweet Potato Chips
note: From the Yotam Ottolenghi cookbook \textit{Simple}. Dad has cooked this a few times. Can skip polenta, can add cinnamon. Works on a barbecue.
steps: Preheat oven to 220 fan forced.
Peel sweet potato and slice into 1.5cm thick chips.
Crush garlic cloves.
Mix sweet potatoes with everything except the sumac and tip onto tray.
Roast for 25-30 minutes, stirring once or twice until golden-brown.
Remove from oven, sprinkle sumac and salt over and serve.

name: White bread (crusty, no-knead)
note: From recipetineats cookbook \textit{Dinner}. Yields a springy bread with a nice crust, doesn't require any kneading. Should try w/o bread flour.
steps: Mix flour, yeast and salt. Add water and stir with handle of a wooden spoon.
Cover and rise until doubled (2-3 hours).
Preheat oven to 230 degrees.
Boil a kettle and fill a 20cm cake tin with boiling water, place in oven on bottom shelf.
Turn dough onto work surface, sprinkle with extra flour and fold sides in with spatula. Place upside down on baking tray and make roughly round.
Bake for 40 minutes until deep golden, cool on rack.

name: Flatbread (Milk)
note: From recipetineats cookbook \textit{Dinner}. Keeping it in a teatowel is a great trick, makes them soft.
steps: Melt butter and milk in saucepan.
Pour flour, salt and milk mix into bowl, mix with wooden spoon.
Turn out onto floured workspace and knead until smooth.
Shape into ball, put in bowl, cover with plastic wrap and leave for 30 minutes.
Break into 6 pieces, roll flat and thin (stop them sticking with extra flour).
Cook in frypan on high heat without oil, for 1.5 min until puffed up and golden, flip and cook for another 1 min. Wrap loosely in teatowel and repeat.

name: Chow Mein
note: From recipetineats book \textit{Dinner}. Buy fridge chow mein noodles, easy to prepare. Still not sure I know what a green onion is.
steps: Mix sauce ingredients.
Finely slice chicken and toss in @1 tbsp of sauce.
Fill noodle packet with hot water and sit for a minute, then drain (or whatever the packet says).
Julienne the carrot, finely shred the wombok, chop shallots into 5 cm pieces, separate white from green. Dice garlic
Heat oil in pan on high, add garlic, fry for 10 seconds.
Add chicken, fry for 1 minute, until brown but still raw.
Add cabbage, carrot and white parts of shallots. Fry for 1.5 minutes until cabbage wilts.
Add noodles, sauce and water, fry for 1 minute tossing constantly.
Add bean sprouts and green parts of shallots, fry for 30 seconds.

name: Broccoli Paella
note: Synthesised from a few sources. Main recipe from \href{https://spainonafork.com/authentic-spanish-vegetable-paella-recipe/}{Spain on a Fork}, but supplemented by technique from \href{https://www.recipetineats.com/spanish-paella/}{Recipe Tin Eats} as well as the chef she mentions, as well as anecdote from paella Mum ate recently and, to confirm use of broccoli \href{https://www.amandaducks.com/recipes/capsicum-paella}{Amanda Ducks}. Apparently not mixing the paprika quick enough will give a bitter flavour. To grate tomato, cut in half and grate the open side, the skin will fan out and eventually be flat, discard it.
steps: Dice onion (~0.5cm pieces), peel, halve and slice carrot (~0.5cm pieces), chop capsicum into strips (~0.5cm wide), split broccoli into florets and halve, slice garlic thinly.
Halve tomatoes and grate into tomato juice.
Warm oil in medium-high heat. Fry broccoli, onion, capsicum and carrot for 3 min
Add garlic, fry for 30 seconds.
Add @1 tsp paprika and quickly stir in, then add tomato juice, mix and simmer for 3 min.
Add stock, bring to boil.
Add arborio, mix (final mix), simmer for 10 min.
Cut lemons into wedges
Reduce heat to medium-low, simmer for 5 min until excess liquid gone.
Raise heat to high, blast for 2 minutes to crisp base.
Remove from heat, cover with foil then teatowel, stand for 5 minutes.
Lightly squeeze lemon wedges over paella then push gently into surface, skin down

diary.content: Cooked for the first time, with Chappell Roan's Red Wine Supernova and My Kink Is Karma on repeat. Stuck to the times above and it went pretty deliciously. Took me 70 minutes but I did also have a half hour phone call with mum so probably could be sped up. Did not get a crust, was a little brown in very middle. Should let it simmer dry more thoroughly on low, and blast on high for longer too. Would be interesting to char broccoli first.

name: Chickpea Curry
note: From a TikTok video I downloaded years ago. Doesn't specify many of the quantities. Makes very little mess. Spinach is here for colour, substitute with green beans etc.
steps: Chop onion into large pieces, slice ginger and garlic thinly.
Sweat onions in large pot for 5 minutes in oil.
Add garlic, ginger. Fry for 3 minutes.
Add spices. Fry 1 minute.
Add tomato paste and chickpeas, fry for 5 minutes (or more?).
Add coconut milk, simmer 10 minutes.
Stir in spinach and cornflour and remove from heat.

diary.content: Two minutes after adding spices seems to burn them, changed to 1 min. Unsure if covered at start, definitely before coconut milk.

name: Vanilla Butter Cake
note: From \href{https://queen.com.au/recipes/perfect-vanilla-butter-cake/}{Queen}, the food dye company, using some of the techniques mentioned in recipetineats' \textit{Dinner}. Can double and make a layer cake.
steps: Preheat oven to 200 degrees.
Let butter soften, let eggs come to room temperature.
Cream butter, sugar and vanilla in mixer until fluffy (5+ minutes).
Grease cake tin
Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each.
Add flour one third at a time, combing after each.
Add milk, mix until combined.
Pour into cake tin. Bake for 55-60 minutes, until skewer tests clean.
Cool for 10 minutes in tin, then cool completely on wire rack. Refrigerate before frosting.

diary.content: Claudia cooked it, worked alright but cake tin dripped. Line it better?

name: Banana Split
note: An important reminder that almost all of the time, I have all the ingredients I need to make a banana split.
steps: Slice banana in half lengthwise and place in a bowl.
Place scoop of icecream in centre of banana.
Drizzle with sauce and sprinkles.

name: Steak Tacos
note: From Claudia, who has cooked it twice for dinner in Eastwood at time of writing. Written up in a handy recipe email for me to write down.
steps: Remove steak from fridge, bring to room temperature for an hour on benchtop.
Dice red onion and avocado into 1 cm cubes.
Mix seasoning ingredients.
Blot steak dry with paper towel, rub with oil then rub with seasoning mix.
Heat 1 tbsp oil on high heat in a frying pan, fry steak for 5 minutes per side. Rest on cutting board covered loosely with foil for 10 minutes.
In clean pan, warm tortillas and fold in half onto serving plate.
Combine sauce ingredients in a jar.
Dice steak into 2cm cubes.
Serve all ingredients separately at table, as well as shredded cheese.

name: Cajun Chicken Pasta
note: From Claudia. Also cooked as whole chicken breasts sans pasta. Sauce coats the pasta in a really fantastic way.
steps: Finely chop garlic. roughly chop sundried tomatoes, reserve oil. Shave parmesan. Dice chicken into large pieces.
Combine seasoning ingredients, reserve @1 tbsp then toss chicken in remaining seasoning.
Heat sundried tomato oil in a pan on medium-high. Sear chicken in batches.
Reduce heat to medium, deglaze pan with white wine. Melt butter and add garlic, fry until fragrant
Boil and salt water for pasta.
Add stock, sundried toamtoes and spinach to pan and reduce for 3 minutes.
Add pasta to pot and cook.
Add cream, parmesan and seasoning and combine, then add chicken. Fry 4 minutes until thickened.
Toss through pasta and serve.

name: Ravioli (ready meal)
note: From the fridge aisle at aldi, this incredible recipe was born. This was the maiden voyage of my Essteele stock pot, gifted by Dad for Christmas 2023.
steps: Cook ravioli per packet instructions.
Add sauce and cook per tub instructions.
Serve with shaved parmesan.
